channel.title: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?
channel.description:
Well - the web client provided by runescape.com is very laggy for me, what Jagex USED to have (back in the day) was a downloadable client to play runescape with - I'm not talking about the runescape.exe you can download from their downloads page - you actually downloaded all the java files and stuff. Well they don't offer that anymore because of client hacking, etc. But I was wondering if there was a way I could download the game, and connect to the main servers. I mean - you wouldn't be changing anything other than the fact your running the applet off your machine, so it seems like it would work fine. This would eliminate some lagg for me.
Plausible?

item.title: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?
item.dc:creator: @459_expert 459 expert
item.description:
@459_expert wrote:

http://www.ul5.runescape.com/runescape.jar

to get the client jar. from there you are on your own.

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?

item.title: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

davidude36:

no - its not a simple task.

I was under the impression that all you had to do was write up an AppletStub set the client’s stub to it?

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?

item.title: Connecting to Jagex's servers with a downloaded client?
item.dc:creator: @Optixs Optixs
item.description:
@Optixs wrote:

[quote=“RLN, post:7, topic:116504”][quote author=Optixs link=topic=165793.msg1544016#msg1544016 date=1182831034]
Yes, they did - you can google cache it if you want, but thats not the point.
I just want to know if it would be a simple task.
[/quote]link? I’ve never heard of anything like this… I’ve seen the webclient one… but never one where they actually gave you the client. It doesn’t make sense, because if they did that ads would be pointless.[/quote]

It was offered when it first came out, you can use the waybackmachine at archive.org to see it. AGAIN - this isnt the point.

Read full topic
